reasoning: Prion diseases encompass transmissible spongiform encephalopathies (TSEs) including sporadic CJD (~1-1.5 per million), familial CJD, variant CJD, GSS, FFI, and extinct kuru. Global incidence estimated at ~1.5 per million annually (0.15 per 100k), dominated by sporadic CJD. Data from CDC surveillance and WHO reports; confidence limited by incomplete global surveillance and declining vCJD cases.
source: CDC Prion Disease Surveillance and WHO Transmissible Spongiform Encephalopathy Reports
